intro: Cynophalla linearis, commonly known as the linear cynophalla, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, featuring narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense, spherical clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits known as cypsela. Cynophalla linearis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
